* Understanding of the the strategic competitive landscape of the industry by staying up to date with trends and customer needs so you can effectively position Workday solutions within accounts
* Experience leveraging and partnering with internal team members on account strategies
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 ,

title: Business Controller
description:
**Join one of Europe's fastest growing SaaS companies in our global expansion. Work together with over +300 amazing colleagues and users all over the world 🚀** 




  





 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and ATS SaaS platform used by over 8 000 companies, 200 000 users in 90 countries around the world 🌏.
 



  





 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a real impact on the growth of an organization and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun 🥳.
 



  





 Building a diverse team with various backgrounds and expertise has been the core of Teamtailor since its very beginning and is part of its strength today! There are no typical profiles, each and every team member shares our vision and wants to be part of its success.
 



  





 Keen to join our Business control and Analytics team? ⭐ As a part of Teamtailors
 **growth journey** 
 we are looking for another
 **Business Controller** 
 to join our team of business controllers, a team comprised of Selin and Hanna. 🚀 You will get to work as a business partner towards Teamtailor departments to improve business performance and efficiency by analyzing financials and key KPIs.
 



  





 We prioritize
 **personality and passion** 
 , we believe in giving you ownership of your work and as a member of our team, you'll have the opportunity to develop your skills with the support of your colleagues. With the
 **right attitude and mindset** 
 , you'll thrive and achieve success together with your team. 🚀
 



  





 What you will do:
 


* Analyze, follow up, and report financial performance on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis for management reporting
* Be a part of and drive the budgeting and forecasting process
* Enable data-driven insights and decision making
* Maintain, improve, and analyze metrics and KPIs
* Create new models for analysis
* Work as a business partner with other Teamtailor departments to identify and improve data, performance, and KPIs
* Prepare and create material for board and external investors
* Work with large sets of data to gain insights into how business performance can be enhanced



  





**What we offer you:** 



* The opportunity to work at one of Europe fastest growing SaaS companies 🚀
* Development opportunities in a fast-growing environment, continuous training, and support
* A great team who always supports and helps each other 💛
* Yearly company trips abroad, kick-offs, after works and breakfast
* Market-relevant salary, pension and health insurance
* Learning budget and social team budget
* Wellness care allowance and regular training sessions with your co-workers 🏋️



  





**Who we think you are:** 



* You have 1-4 years of work experience from a similar role
* Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office, primarily Excel
* MS Power Query is beneficial but not an requirement
* Previous experience in initiating and driving projects
* Analytical, structured, and proactive
* Financial experience, e.g. PL, budget, and management reporting
* You're fluent in English and have basic Swedish understanding



  





*You'll be working full-time at our Stockholm office 📍 For us, personality and passion are the most important things. Joining Teamtailor means being part of a fun and ambitious team. We look forward to hearing from you!*

title: Security and SHEQ Manager, Nordics/DACH
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
**Olivier Dussutour** 
 , our CEO, is seeking for a Security and SHEQ (Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality) Manager to uphold top standards of security, safety and quality frameworks.
   

  

 If you thrive in tech and international environments this might be the right opportunity for you. You will have the opportunity to shape and impact a security-aware organization across Europe, helping us reinforce our core business of trust.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage with various departments to cultivate a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
* Lead initiatives that prioritize sustainability and environmental responsibility.
* At Nexus, part of IN Groupe, we are leaders in high-tech trust and safety solutions. As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you'll be a pivotal player in a company where trust is central. Your work will have a significant impact on our commitment to innovation and the standards we set in the industry.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you will be the key figure overseeing comprehensive security programs across the Nordics and Germany, with a primary focus on general security and safety. A special focus will be on physical security and business continuity. You will also act as the Chief of security in tenders and in client interactions. You will develop and implement strategies to protect assets, facilities, and personnel, while also managing SHEQ systems to promote a culture of safety, compliance, and operational excellence throughout the organization.
   

  

**Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Develop and implement comprehensive physical security policies, protocols and procedures to safeguard facilities, personnel, and assets.
* Work closely with our corporate information security team to ensure seamless integration of cybersecurity and physical security measures for a unified security approach.
* Lead and conduct risk assessments for both physical security and SHEQ aspects; develop and execute effective mitigation strategies.
* Manage security personnel and coordinate with facilities management to maintain secure environments across locations.
* Develop, implement, and maintain robust SHEQ management systems in compliance with regulatory standards and organizational goals and liaison with group counterparts to cascade group policy.
* Lead incident investigations related to security breaches and SHEQ incidents; implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for SHEQ initiatives; report on performance to senior management.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance safety, environmental sustainability, and overall quality standards organization-wide.


**About You**
* You take pride in your meticulous approach, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in every task.
* You confidently express your ideas and decisions, driving projects forward effectively.
* You enjoy anticipating needs and opportunities, taking initiative to address issues and drive improvements.
* You excel at analyzing complex situations, deriving meaningful insights from data.
* You maintain positivity and adaptability in overcoming challenges and setbacks.


**Qualifications**
* You possess a relevant academic degree.
* You are experienced in the Security field.
* You are fluent in Swedish and proficient English.
* You are experienced with ISO 9001.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* You are experienced in Tech and infrastructure.
* You are familiar with ISO 27001, ISO 14001 and TISAX.
* You are experienced in SOA classification.


**About Your Application**
 Please note that due to summer vacations, the feedback on applications may be slower during the month of July. However, we encourage you to apply as we will review all applications and respond as soon as possible.
   

  

**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Please upload your CV in English or Swedish.**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.

title: Group Manager - VCF Enablement team within Group Solution Development Enablement (GSDE)
description:
Scania, as part of Traton, is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**The position and the group**
*Do you want to be a part of shaping the future of the TRATON R&D, leading the digital journey and at the same time securing the modular system? Then we have an unique opportunity for you!*
 We are looking for a Group Manager that can ensure the flow capacity and capability for the team on Value Creation Flow level when the Scania and TRATON’s future processes, information & IT landscape continue developing. The group covers solutions, architecture and flow at the VCF level.
   

  

 The group is responsible for:
   

  

  

* Create clarity in the vision & mission for the VCF and secure awareness of overall strategy fulfilment
* Owning, ensuring prioritization and updating the VCF backlog so that it is transparent and clear to all stakeholders
* Coach the VCTs in continuously improving the flow of value and advocate a lean agile mindset and culture
* Facilitate VCF events like pre and post-PI Planning and Solution demos
* Drive relentless improvement via Inspect and Adapt workshops
* Lead and guide the organisation in how to set new business architecture and processes in the transformation together with stakeholders from all over Scania and the other brands within TRATON.


 You will be the key player in coaching and developing the leadership triad of the Value Creation Flow and the Flow Initiative Owners and you will help improvements going forward. You will have the opportunity to work in a team focusing on leading the agile transformation, forming the VCF level together with the VCT:s. The group consists of senior members with long experience. We succeed and fail together. You will be part of the EYM department management team.
   

  

**About You**
 You have been working as a leader for more than 5 years. You have a strong customer focus and agile mindset combined with a solid experience with the processes, information and IT landscape within Scania supporting the modular system.
   

  

 You can understand, apply and convey the Scania and Traton business strategies.
   

  

 As a person, you are a driven, flexible, servant leader and team player able to work with everyone in the organisation. A condition is that you are interested in people, have good communication skills and that you want to share knowledge with others.
   

  

 You probably have an academic degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
   

  

 It is meriting if you have worked with cross-company or cross-organizational collaboration.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Enable flow: Removing obstacles, coaching and mentoring the flow. Go to the flow to stay informed and guide.
* Career growth and personal development for your team members
* Supporting and strengthening lean-agile methodology
* Facilitate innovation and improvements in the team
* Ensure effective design practices, design guidelines and competence development
* Give input on budget and capacity need


**We offer**
* A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to participate in the design of an automotive global champion with more than 100 000 employees.
* The chance to learn about the newest technologies in an agile environment
* Be part of an agile transformation journey
* A hybrid working mode, with high flexibility of combining remote and office work


 As a Scania employee, in addition to career and development opportunities, you will be offered other benefits such as a company car, a performance bonus, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm we also provide a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje via Scania Job Express.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact Michael Thel, Engineering Director, +46 855381694
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30 June 2024. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 If you think this sounds like a nice challenge, please apply!

title: Senior Product Data Scientist | Candy Crush
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Senior Product Data Scientist**
 We are looking for a versatile and creative Product Data Scientist interested in building, defining and pushing the boundaries of game analytics and AB test analysis! You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioral or economic, in order to generate value for the mobile games we create here at King.
   

  

 Candy Crush Saga is one of the world’s most popular mobile games. Millions of players around the globe match colourful candies in combinations of three or more to win points, defeat obstacles and progress through more than 15,000+ levels. In November 2022, Candy Crush Saga celebrated its 10-year anniversary. Candy Crush Saga is available to download for free from the Apple App Store, Google Play, Amazon App store, Windows App Store and Facebook.
   

  

**Your Role**
 You’ll help us to further understand, segment, predict and retain our players. We want you to be part of our Candy Crush Core Gameplay Team, which is a cross-functional team consisting of other Data Scientists, Product Managers, Game Designers and Developers, where you’ll be tasked to drive the analytical side of the game, collaborating with the broader group!
   

  

**Specifically, you’ll:**
* Design, monitor, analyze and communicate results for AB tests
* Translate business needs to technical and AB test requirements, then work with development teams to ensure correct implementation and event tracking
* Work closely with game designers and product team to scope and design tests to identify potential opportunities (e.g. player behavior, game economy)
* Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to harness business opportunities
* Carefully check and problem solve issues to ensure the correct operations of the game, even when confronted by subtle data complications
* Provide a business analytical perspective to discussions and help to drive the priorities within your game
* Champion data literacy within the cross-functional game team, and share your knowledge with the wider Data Science community


**Skills to create thrills:**
 You have a passion for quantitative analysis, understanding player behaviour and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You are able to learn quickly and have worked in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Producers and Game Artists, so broad interpersonal skills are critical.
   

  

**You need to be proficient in the following key skills:**
* Product insight: You are capable of using data to gain deep understanding of game mechanics and impacts on player behavior to solve business problems such as: feature implementation and optimizations, player economy optimization, main critical metric shift, tracking bugs, marketing impact.
* Data Storytelling: You understand how to communicate, visualize and report your findings in a clear and unambiguous way to people with diverse degrees of numerical proficiency.
* Technical skills: You can extract, manipulate and visualize the data and you have an understanding of applied statistics (probability, causality and time series). We make intensive usage of SQL, cloud services and the Python/R analytical stack, so having prior experience in at least two of these domains is definitely a plus.


 There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.
   

  

**Specific prior experience that might be useful, but is not required, includes:**
* Experience in the games industry or customer-facing digital businesses
* Behavioral psychology/economics/game theory
* Working knowledge of randomized controlled trials (ex: social science research, medical research, biostatistics, policy research etc.) or digital A/B testing and online controlled experiments
* Experience with an experimentation platform or with conversion rate optimization (CRO) for Apps
* Software engineering skills
* Standard reporting tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc.
* Cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery


**About King**
 At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Performance Marketing Manager
description:
***Devoted to measurable results, with experience from credit and passion for storytelling***




  





  





**First things first:** 




*Let’s talk about what really matters, what is truly essential to being a part of the marketing team at Fairlo.* 




  





**A passion for doing good things for the users:** 




 We believe in a fair world, even when it comes to money. We believe people deserve better. Fairlo is on a mission to level the playing field and outsmart the predatory credit market. This vision dictates that everyone at Fairlo needs to be passionate about doing good, within the framework that is an inherently shitty credit industry. For our new Performance Marketing Manager this means that you need to have a heart and truly care about finding that perfect balance between generating conversions and doing so responsibly; and a track record to prove it.
 



  





**A passion for being great at what you do:** 




 We’re looking for a hybrid polymath talent. Yes, the role will be centered around our affiliate partnerships, Google, brokers, Meta and whatever else you decide to use, but you will also be involved in other, more brand-oriented, projects. So, besides pure performance, you need to have an interest in brand building and a thoroughly developed sense of written communication, in Swedish as well as English.
 



  





**A passion for becoming a world-class leader:** 




 We’re aiming high, not only in the scope of our fairness vision but also in terms of how ambitiously we’re approaching our marketing efforts. We want to create a unique credit brand that sets a new standard. We want to think new and experiment. We want you to grow with the task, pushing the rest of us to grow alongside you. We have our roots in Stockholm and we’re on the verge of launching in the UK and beyond that, the world. And everything in it.
 



  





**Now, where we’re coming from:** 




 Two brothers with artistic dreams. A mother with a hard will to give her children the foundation to realize them. A wallet with holes in it. The loan, which was the answer to everything, became the beginning of a disastrous journey. Because even though she paid back on time, the loan amount still increased. As did the hole in her wallet. An event that left its deep marks.
 



 There and then, a seed was planted. A seed that has grown into a business built around mutual respect and fairness. Our solid values inspire us to consistently be innovative and create new services that surpass banks and well-known credit card brands. And the best part is we've just begun!
 



  





**About Fairlo:** 




 With innovative technology as our tool and our desire for equality as our energy, we've come far. But we're nowhere near where we want to be. Our ambition is to help millions of people get access to sustainable finances.
 



  





 In 2018 we launched our first-ever service:
 **Fairlo Varda** 
 . To this date, Varda has helped over 40,000 people access a sustainable and beneficial credit line.
 



  





**We’re also happy to brag about:** 



* Some of Sweden's most experienced business angels and investors share our vision and support our work.
* Won the yearly accelerator program at Sting (Stockholm Innovation & Growth) in 2019, amongst a group of 19 hot startups.
* One of only two Swedish companies on top 10 of Financial Times and Statista's 2024 ranking of Europe's fastest-growing companies.
* Licensed the UK. We'll be launching to the British public this spring.
* A team spread across three countries, all working for a fair(lo) world.
* Almost 4000 reviews on Trustpilot, with an average rating of 4.7, 91% of these raving five star reviews.
* Our very own tech hub on Crete, developing our proprietary innovations.
* Not to forget; a competitive benefit package, a hybrid work model and a fun and caring culture that will help you to grow with us.



  





**But most importantly, we’d like to brag about our culture:** 




 The Fairlo culture that we cherish and are very proud of, is characterized by truly caring for each other, teamwork, courage and respect - and of course a burning passion for trying to do good and be fair in everything we do. We are convinced our strong and kind culture is one of the main reasons for Fairo's success. We are now looking for a natural team player and people oriented superstar to join us as our Performance Marketing Manager and help us become an even greater place to be and the best global financial partner out there, all based on a culture of fairness.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Manage our performance marketing (including our affiliate marketing).
* Lead our outbound communication.
* Work closely with our CMO to formulate strategies, for brand as well as performance.
* Ideate, execute and follow up on campaigns.
* Write clear and engaging copy.
* Analyze performance and report insights on a weekly basis.
* Oversee our SEO.
* Be a member of our strategy team working cross-disciplinary.
* Assist the risk team with efforts to decrease credit losses and improve profitability.
* Assist the customer service team with customer review management.
* Work across the business with everything from partnerships to customer engagement.



  





**We believe you have:** 



* Minimum 3 years of professional experience from planning and executing performance marketing for a financial service, e.g. a fintech or credit provider.
* Have experience from affiliate marketing and partnerships, from identifying, scoping, planning and executing to measuring and iterative adjusting.
* Have experience with Google ads and other performance marketing platforms, e.g. Meta.
* A relevant academic degree doesn’t hurt, e.g. a bachelor’s degree in business and/or marketing.
* Are an excellent communicator in both Swedish and English.
* Are a problem solver and an independent doer with a will to learn and improve.
* Are good at negotiating and not afraid to speak in front of people.
* Can keep track of things and are organized.
* Can analyze data and draw conclusions from it.
* Startup experience is a plus but not a must.
* Experience from using Drip, Clicksend and/or other CRM-platforms would be great as well.
* You don’t need to have experience from brand strategy and tactics but it’d be great if you have an interest, so that we can grow your role and competence over time.



  





**Language:** 




 Working proficiency in written and spoken English.
 



  





**Where you'll work:** 




 This position is based in Stockholm, but includes some travel to our offices in Heraklion and London.
 



  





 We believe in finding people with unique backgrounds and perspectives ready to change the world through their visions. We hope we've piqued your interest.

title: Nordic HSSE Manager
description:
We are now searching for a – Nordic HSSE Manager - to join the Bitumen Supply Chain Team in Stockholm.
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced HSSE professional to help us improve our performance and focus on safe operations. The ideal candidate will be a proactive leader with a strong background in HSSE management preferably from the chemical or oil sector.
   

  

 This role serves as the primary point of contact regarding HSSE for the Bitumen Supply Chain within the Nordic Region, encompassing the following tasks and responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop and Implement HSSE Policies: Design, implement, and continually improve HSSE policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
* Site Inspections: Conduct regular site inspections at our customers delivery sites to identify HSSE hazards and ensure compliance with established policies and procedures.
* Risk Assessments: Conduct regular risk assessments for our operations, identifying potential hazards and implementing measures to mitigate risks to personnel, equipment, and the environment.
* Training and Education: Develop and deliver HSSE training to the Supply Chain organisation, and external stakeholders for example Nynas Haulers
* Incident Investigations: Perform investigations of incidents, analyzing root causes and proposing corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
* Compliance and KPI Monitoring: Monitor compliance with HSSE regulations and standards, conducting audits and inspections to identify areas for improvement and ensure adherence to established protocols.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with depots, sales, customers, and the internal HSSE network to promote a good HSSE culture


**You will also be an active part in** 
 the Bitumen Supply Chain Management Team which has the responsibility for Nynas depots, Bitumen supply and planning, and transportation. The role will be a mix of theoretical and practical work and with some traveling to mainly to the Nordic counties.
   

  

**About You**
 The successful candidate has preferably an academic degree within the HSSE area or have several years’ experience in a similar role. Technical experience from a chemical or oil industry would be beneficial. The candidate must have a valid driver’s license and not afraid to learn new IT systems. Moreover, the ideal candidate should demonstrate strong communication skills and fluency in Swedish and English.
   

  

 We are seeking applicants who live our company values of dedication, cooperation and proactivity. The candidate has a good basic understanding of logistics, is structured, positive, service minded, resilient, open to changes, gets motivated by new challenges and achieving results and has good social, influencing and diplomatic skills. The candidate is expected to work independently and often under pressure and embraces the reality that it may not always be feasible to please everybody.
   

  

**In return** 
 , we offer challenging tasks in a highly motivated and international environment that allows you to continuously learn new things to utilize all your skills and to grow personally and professionally. The role offers many opportunities to interact with highly skilled colleagues at various technical and commercial departments globally, making an impact within Nynas.
   

  

 We are both big and small at the same time – which gives our employees a unique opportunity. You have the advantages of a strong, international corporation with the possibility to develop your career along many different paths. But we still are small enough so you will never be lost in the crowd. Here at Nynas, every individual is a key player. This means that there is often pressure on you to deliver, but it also means that you are well known and always seen as an important part of a large family - Join us in our transition towards a more sustainable society.
   

  

 This position is based in our new head office, 26th floor (Sthlm01) in Stockholm and reports to the Bitumen Operations Director.
   

  

**About Nynas**
**Solutions for the transition to a sustainable society.**
 Nynas offers bitumen and naphthenic specialty products for applications that touch people’s lives every day, for example in electrification and road infrastructure. Our core competence is to refine heavy molecules into high performance, long-lasting specialty products. We operate in an international market with a strong focus on Europe, working closely with customers to create solutions to meet challenges and capture opportunities in the transition to a sustainable society.
   

  

**Contact** 
 :
   

  

 We look forward to reading your application before August 5 th , the latest.
   

  

 For more information and questions about the role, please contact Petter Stange, Operations Director, petter.stange@nynas.com

title: Manufacturing Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 Our Upplands Väsby plant is going through an exciting period of change. We are looking to recruit a key role within the Leadership Team, reporting directly to the Plant Director. This a key leadership role and will require coaching and motivation of staff at multiple levels to ensure effective delivery of the daily performance through the alignment of resources (people, plant and process) to meet defined KPIs and Operational targets.
   

  

 This role is key in driving the IL6S agenda, throughout the manufacturing plant, and cross functionally, with other key areas of the business. A key element of this is the development of a strong process and continuous improvement culture is expected through building the capabilities of the teams within the section across the whole SQCDSM agenda. You put people at the centre of the operation. You act with integrity at all times and recognize that sustainability is driven through strong leadership aligned to a committed support to the teams and the primary process.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Be the Safety Leader for production by the active support and role modelling of Safety programmes and reinforce safe behaviour of production team members.
* Ensure that all products comply with product specifications. Ensure that all Quality Policies and Safety regulations are in place, understood, monitored and followed by corrective actions
* Deliver according to production plan in line with conversion costs, loss rate and recipes. Responsible for production planning and scheduling following the demand requirements
* Works cross functionally to develop and implement a mid to long-term strategic plan and annual operating plan, proactively identify key opportunities and link strategy to action to enable safe, reliable, flexible and cost efficient manufacturing capability that is a demonstrable competitive advantage to Mondelēz. Partner with multi-functional leads to define and meet Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability, Engagement goals. Establish a strong governance to review & control operational performance and continuous Improvement plan and embed a zero loss mindset across the site to deliver against best in class both internally and externally
* Provide coaching towards implementation of IL6S-Integrated Lean 6 sigma ways of working and phase journey as per masterplan and Self-sufficient teams. Role model Values and principles through effective coaching, mentoring and development of the multi-functional team
* Lead and be accountable for all Manufacturing standards, Governance, Compliance requirements are in place, understood by all employees at the site, and regularly reviewed and monitored for compliance to policy.
* Interface with Key stakeholders internally & externally to establish/maintain effective relationships, align priorities in order to deliver the company objectives, goals and build the company equity and image.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* Significant experience in leading manufacturing performance in a fast-moving manufacturing environment with exceptional results with a career that has seen time at the Front Line and/or Manufacturing Manager level.
* Demonstrable and intuitive knowledge on fundamentals of good manufacturing practice, process improvement and optimization.
* Proven track record in strong engagement with teams, from shop floor to leadership team.
* Experience in leading and driving a growth and change agenda.
* Strong knowledge and experience within Continuous Improvement, LEAN manufacturing, TPM, IL6S. Acting as a change agent you will lead the section and influence the site team to develop the operational teams to achieve levels of ability, knowledge and independence (autonomy) that leverages team working and flexibility.
* Excellent communication in Swedish and English (verbal & written), coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment.
* Experience in interfacing with the broader Supply Chain and Commercial functions and a high level of capability around managing relationships and outcomes with Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Logistics, Customer Service, Category and Sales.
* Fluency in Swedish language.


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Manufacturing support
   

  

 Manufacturing

title: Finance Manager
description:
**Once upon a time, a big bank scammed Jimmy’s mum into unsustainable debt.** 




 The idea behind Fairlo was born when our founder Jimmy and his brother Shamon realised that a big, well-known, bank had tricked their mother into a never ending spiral of debt through deceptive wording and predatory terms. The brothers thought to themselves, “it has to be possible to create a credit service that is fair, that is built on mutual trust and respect, that isn't all about taking advantage of vulnerable and unaware people”. That thought sparked “The Fair Loan Project” which ultimately became Fairlo.
 



  





**About Fairlo** 




 Fairlo is a fintech company with over 30 000 active customers, driven by a strong culture rooted in the idea of delivering a more fair and more sustainable life-happens buffer, an alternative to predatory credit cards, expensive loans and sneaky buy-now-pay-later. Fairlo was launched in 2018 and today has a 4.7 score on Trustpilot from more than 3 700 reviews, combined with an exceptionally low customer churn.
 



  





 We're a team of 25 people, based in Stockholm and on the Greek paradise island of Crete where our tech hub is and also a passionate UK team on the cusp of launching Fairlo to the British market.
 



  





**We're also happy to have:** 



* Some of Sweden's most experienced investors that share our vision and support our work.
* Annual revenue exceeding 150 MSEK
* Won the yearly accelerator program at Sting (Stockholm Innovation & Growth) in 2019, amongst a group of 19 hot startups.
* Not to forget; a competitive benefit package, a hybrid work model and a fun and caring culture that will help you to grow with us.
* The ninth fastest growing company in Europe according to Financial Times 2024.



  





**Are you our new Finance manager?** 




 At Fairlo, the culture we cherish and are very proud of is characterised by truly caring for each other, teamwork, courage, respect and of course a burning passion for trying to do good and be fair in everything we do. We are convinced our strong and kind culture is one of the main reasons for Fairlo's success. In the next chapter of our journey we have some very exciting new things cooking and to make the best soup ever tasted, we are now looking for a prestigeless, natural team player to join our dedicated team and help us accelerate our journey in the Finance team as our Finance manager for the Swedish & UK market.
 



  





**Some of the things you’ll do:** 



* Work closely together with our amazing Finance manager Simon in daily operations across everything regarding the finances at Fairlo.
* Manage bookkeeping, account payables and receivables.
* Handle salaries.
* Assist with monthly and yearly reconciliations, monthly and annual reports, declarations and audits.
* Receipt management.
* Extract and collate revenue data from internal systems through Excel.
* General administration
* Work closely together with the founders and the rest of the team in a down-to-earth and highly passionate organisation, where culture is one of our most precious assets.



  





**We believe you:** 



* Have at least 4 years of experience within accounting having covered at least account payables, payments, bookkeeping and monthly reconciliations.
* Have a bachelor’s degree in finance or a YH education within accounting.
* Have a strong business acumen.
* Are curious, fearless and want to learn new things.
* Are process oriented.
* Have the drive to get your hands dirty.
* Are a good communicator.



  





**Nice if you also have experience from:** 



* Credit institutes or niche banks.
* Working in Fortnox.
* Working with annual reports.
* Working with group accounting.
* Working in Excel.



  





**Joining Fairlo means:** 



* You get to be part of building a financial world you’d like to live in.
* A competitive salary and benefits package including stock options program, health insurance, pension, health & wellness allowance.
* Hybrid working framework.
* High-end laptop and equipment.
* Top location in Stockholm.
* Be part of a team that supports each other, have fun together and thrive.



  





**Language:** 




 Working proficiency in written and spoken Swedish and English.
 



  





**Where you'll work:** 




 Mainly in our Stockholm office, and you may travel to other Fairlo offices in the UK, Greece and soon other places.
 



  





 We believe in finding people with unique backgrounds and perspectives ready to change the world through their visions.
 



  





 We hope we've piqued your interest. Apply, and take the first step towards being a part of making Fairlo an even greater place to be and the best global financial partner out there, all based on a culture of fairness.

title: Sjukhuskemist till biokemi, CMMS
description:
*Nu finns chansen att bli sjukhuskemist i ett av Europas ledande laboratorier för diagnostik av medfödda ämnesomsättningssjukdomar!*
**Du erbjuds**
* en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö där din kompetensutveckling står i fokus
* att bli en del av en väl sammansvetsad grupp av sjukhuskemister, läkare och biomedicinska analytiker som tillsammans arbetar för att bota, lindra och diagnosticera en rad sällsynta medfödda metabola sjukdomar.


 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset får du också ta del av de förmåner som vi erbjuder.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 På Centrum för medfödda metabola sjukdomar (CMMS) arbetar vi med precisionsdiagnostik för många olika typer av sällsynta sjukdomar. Vi tar ett helhetsgrepp om våra patienter - vi kombinerar helgenomsekvensering med biokemisk analys. Vi kartlägger gener, enzymaktiviteter och metaboliter hos våra patienter. Det är metaboliterna, de små organiska kroppsegna molekylerna vi är särskilt intresserade av på biokemilaboratoriet. Vi är ett ackrediterat specialistlaboratorium som med masspektrometriska analysmetoder genererar den biokemiska data som hjälper våra läkare ställa diagnoser på våra patienter.
   

  

 Samhället digitaliseras, det gör även vi. Därför har vi under det senaste året utökat våra färdigheter inom dataanalys med interaktiva kurser inom bland annat R, Python och SQL. I din roll som sjukhuskemist kommer du att utveckla, validera samt i samråd med medicinskt ansvarig läkare driftsätta nya metoder och kontinuerligt förbättra befintliga analysmetoder och tillhörande processer. Du kommer att ansvara för metodunderhåll, bistå vid felsökningar och utgöra stöd vid resultatutvärdering. Arbetet innehåller både rutinmässiga och projektorienterade uppgifter. Dessutom kommer du att ansvara för kvalitetssäkring med därtill hörande uppdateringar av dokument och kvartalsstatistik. Utåt förväntas du också handleda studenter samt nätverka mot andra laboratorier.
   

  

 I denna tjänst kommer 6 månaders provanställning att tillämpas.
   

  

*Vi värnar om våra data. Våra data räddar liv!*
**Vi söker dig som**
* arbetar prestationsorienterat, kvalitetsmedvetet och är prestigelös till sättet.
* besitter en problemlösande analytisk förmåga.
* ett serviceinriktat "mindset" i kombination med en positiv attityd, vilket är av avgörande betydelse för en fantastisk arbetsmiljö
* vill engagera dig i den större verksamheten och på ett aktivt sätt bidra till dialog och utveckling på din arbetsplats.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
*Krav:*
* Doktorsexamen inom analytisk kemi, biokemi eller annat relevant område.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Innehar IT-vana samt besitter kunskap i grundläggande statistik.


*Meriterande:*
* Erfarenhet av LC-MS/MS, exempelvis metodutveckling


*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!*
 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Läs mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska här.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Funktion Medicinsk Diagnostik Karolinska**
 Funktion Medicinsk Diagnostik Karolinska är en sammanslagning av Karolinska Universitetslaboratoriet och Bild och Funktion med laboratorieverksamhet, radiologi, nuklearmedicin, medicinsk strålningsfysik, radiofarmaci och strålsäkerhet inom Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om Medicinsk Diagnostik Karolinska.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om Karolinska Universitetslaboratoriet.
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/3564 | Kontakt: Erik Hedman 076-2317892, | Facklig företrädare: Leif Karlsson, Naturvetarna 070-1417484, | Publicerat: 2024-06-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-23

title: IL6S and Productivity Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 OWN the IL6S program implementation at the site, ensuring IL6S work is loss focused and targeted for delivering site CBN. Set directions and make adjustments needed to keep the program moving at the pace defined by the leadership team. Use learning from corporate and regional teams and other benchmarks. Learn continuously by doing and teaching current phase subjects as well future phase capability required. Work closely with Pillar Teams and Ensure an effective integration of all pillars.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Own the IL6S program at plant level.
* Address current capability needs to deliver the site CBN.
* Address future capability needs to deliver the site CBN.
* Participate in regional/ corporate IL6S program implementation.


**What You Will Bring**
* LEADERSHIP SKILLS: Demonstrated ability to lead and cause positive cultural change within teams or organizations. Able to influence and motivate people with diverse skills and experiences to achieve excellent results. Self-motivated to resolve issues and follow-through to completion (especially complex technical or capability issues). Lead the operation to deliver benchmark manufacturing results.
* COMMUNICATION & COLLABORATION SKILLS: Able to collaborate confidently and effectively across several organizational boundaries (language, geographic, business unit). Ability to lead and participate on global and multi-functional teams. Ability to coach and inspire other Managers and technicians to deliver operational excellence.
* KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE: Technical knowledge of manufacturing. Ability to identify and eliminate defects and losses across the Supply Chain. Able to effectively start up new lines, operations or new initiatives.
* IL6S: Coach and develop site IL6S resources. Able to use IL6S methodology and principles to eliminate losses though total employee involvement. Ability to integrate module master plan with other leaders on the Plant Leadership Team. Able to lead and coach pillar implementation and integration. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Own the development and execution of Daily Management Systems.
* TECHNICAL OR OPERATIONAL EXPERIENCE: Able to coach and develop staff and contractors in a way that integrates with the site's work system. Operational experience on engineering, processing, packing or shipping/logistics.
* COACHING/CULTURAL CHANGE: This role requires the ability to deliver results through others. Demonstrated ability to develop capability in Managers, Technicians and Contractors. Able to identify and leverage the unique capabilities of others and build successful teams. Demonstrated ability to inspire others and lead cultural change in a mature organization.


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
